job_title: FNP C in Grants Pass, OR
pros: I have worked for Asante for 18 years. It was a great work environment. They often had shifting goals and difficulty with retention but I believed in the overall mission to provide quality health care to our community. However with the governors vaccine mandate in 2021, Asante jumped in with both feet. They allowed 0 accommodation for any employee who chose not to become vaccinated. This includes anyone with previous immunity. Thus laying off hundreds of highly skilled, loyal employees. This not only harms the now unemployed health care workers but also the community at large. Unfortunately, I don't believe in the mission any longer.
cons: Retention issues contribute to long-term instability

review_title: Asante exists to provide quality health care services in a compassionate manner valued by the communities we serve.

pros: Excellent Pay, Benefits, and work environment

review_title: Respectable leadership during a difficult time for hospitals and the economy in general.
pros: Difficult staffing always left opportunities for overtime. They were working towards Magnet status which is something many hospitals are striving for. I got the inpression from some of those involved in this process that they were not entirely committed to this process, but were rather going through the motions to make the necessary happen. They did complete a nice expansion of the hospital in Medford, which was a plus for both the staff and patients alike. As always, there where things that could be done better, but that's business. Overall, most people seemed satisfied with their positions. I hope this gives you some insight.
cons: Not a lot of opportunities for advancement. Saw lots of traveling nurses while at that hospital, which was indicative of the constant staffing shortages. My phone rang within 4 hours of my being home nearly 7 days/week asking me to come back again that night. I believe they only had one pharmacist at night covering the orders for two hospitals. This was a major problem for the nursing staff. Would have liked to see the senior management have some open door/town hall meetings to allow staff to air out issues that could make the organization more sucessful. Saw someone (competent) sit in an interim management position for nearly two years, before management decided to put someone else in the position. That was quite demoralizing for the staff.

pros: Largest hospital in the area. Better employment opportunities than other hospitals in the area. Pay rate compared to non-union nursing jobs is considerable.
cons: Employees are not appreciated as much as upper management at times.

pros: This is a union hospital so the pay is good
cons: The nurse directors and managers are a clique

review_title: Don't work here!!  Your opinions and suggestions are not appreciated.
job_title: Physician Assistant in Grants Pass, OR
pros: Good benefits.  Southern Oregon is nice if you like QUIET and the outdoors.  Coming from the San Francisco area however, it was a bit of a culture shock.
cons:
I was hired as an Emergency Department Physician Assistant.  During my interview I was told I would get main ED time with high acuity patients.
Upon my arrival, I was moved into an "Express Care" area that was on the other side of the hospital.  Low acuity and boring.  In addition, any tweeks I tried to implement to improve throughput was regarded as insubordination and "rocking the boat."   No innovation was encouraged and both the ER manager and ER director created an environment of "My way, or the highway!"     Every question was considered a complaint, and every suggestion was received as a threat to their authority and,  "You haven't been here long enough to contribute."  Needless to say, I was shown the highway after only two months.
I would never recommend this place to a fellow mid-level, simply because of the piss-poor management and the slew of broken promises they make to get you in the door.

pros: Decent pay and the staff are team oriented
cons: The Benefits are not great

pros: At Three rivers hospital, all of the clinical staff - nurses, lab, pharmacy, discharge planners etc- are very professional, helpful and a pleasure to work with - makes for an excellent work environment.
cons:
The hospitalist group at TRMC is managed under "APP" or Asante Physician Partners - I am very disappointed with managers at APP. I will leave soon because I have lost trust in both their competence and their honesty of intent. Our group has had every imaginable and some unimaginable problems with them.
Our hospitalist program (three rivers hospital) is seeing some rapid attrition despite an otherwise pleasant work environment that I described under Pros. 
Again to be clear- TRMC is an excellent place to work, it is APP that manages the hospitalist group that I can no longer bear to work with. I feel APP is doing TRMC a great disservice

pros: Employees are their greatest asset. Those who work here strive for excellence and create a work family that support and care for each other, as well as the patients. They really provide the best health care for the area they serve. There simply isn't valid competition geographically. The nurses have a union, so some employee rights are protected.
cons: This corporation seems focused on the minutia, while losing site of the big picture. Employees often feel that they are being "nickled & dimed" by managerial actions. The management team is poorly organized and seemingly dysfunctional. There is a lot of turnover and policies are changed at random, as leadership comes and goes. The focus on profit detracts from the quality of service and the enjoyment of the working environment. Some leaders exhibit an accuse and blame management style that compels most under their leadership to keep their mouths shut. That makes transparency and improvement projects nearly impossible.

review_title: One of the top Hospitals, and Hospital systems in the entire US!  In one of the most beautiful places on earth!
job_title: Registered Nurse in Central Point, OR
pros: Some of the highest wage to cost of living ratios in the country!  Every outdoor activity you could ever want, is here. Strong growth opportunities!  Rogue Regional Medical Center is The #1 Top hospital in the entire USA for cardio thoracic surgery, just named 2018!
cons: As with most systems, top level administration pay/bonuses are ridiculously inflated, at the expense of some departments, and some maintenance!  Employees cost of healthcare premiums are higher than they ought to be, but I’ve heard from travelers, ours is about average, across the board.  They do provide a sizable discount for procedures preformed in network. Which helps tremendously if you need surgery.  Otherwise, benefits package it very, very good!

job_title: Communications and Marketing in Medford, OR
pros: I can't express how much I love this company. Having come from another health system with an authoritarian, often toxic, culture I have a special appreciation for Asante. It's led by good people, who in turn hire good managers and supervisors. The culture is collegial, supportive and fun. Team members from all ranks participate in task forces and planning groups, allowing them to develop their skills and gain notice among senior leaders. Pay and benefits are above average for the area and are set by a market analysis to stay competitive.
cons: The organization is flat, so opportunities for advancement are limited in smaller departments.  For larger departments, however, advancement is common. The organization could benefit from formalized career tracks.

review_title: Great pay, and benefits. To much corporate crap, and back stabbing.
pros: Great benefits and pay (depending on departments). I really can't think of anything else positive about the job. I will take up space.
cons: Getting passed over for job opportunity and advancements. Words that work, is lying to people to ensure the company looks good. Way to much corporate crap for me, time for a new job.

review_title: I have been very happy at AACH for 24 years
pros: I have felt supported by administration and feel I am paid well.  The hospital is set in a small  community and has a "hometown" feel.  I like the fact I have time to spend with patients and concentrate on their physical needs as well as have time to get to chat on a personal level.
cons: We don't have very many specialists that refer to the hospital so we are limited in the type of exams we perform in the radiology dept.

pros: Good benefits and good wages.
cons: Middle management never seems to be on the same page as administration or the claimed philosophies of the company.  Terrible communication from middle management. There’s a pattern of playing favorites that makes it feel more like the good ole boys club at times.

review_title: Be very careful when considering this organization for employment
pros: It is one of few options in the area.  That said benefits are good, but the bar is low.  Staff shortages are a common problem.  If you like working long hours with out a lot of support staff this is your place.
cons: Productivity is of the utmost concern for managers, so much so that patient care is compromised.  Managers are hired because of who they know and how well they get along with administrators.  The administrators are really out of touch with the employee in the trenches.

pros: Challenging environment, not-for-profit mentality of spending money where it matters, typical healthcare IT issues that are being dealt with across the vertical, IT systems well ahead of similarly sized healthcare environments.
cons: Poor employee retention, no staffing plan unless you're an Epic analyst, complacent management, zero process improvement, poor implementation of structure, lots of bad apples, management doesn't value or encourage certification (unless it's an Epic cert).

review_title: A great place to work, one of top 15 systems in the country!
pros:
Organization that has values
Organization that lives its values
Organization that provides outstanding patient care and quality outcomes and services
Organization with outstanding people at all levels
cons:
Staffing can be a challenge,especially when there is a high census day, week, month
Many employees have only worked at Asante, they don't know anything but Asante and the way Asante does things; they don't know how to challenge or help Asante be better, they only know how to complain about the way things are

job_title: Human Resources Director in Medford, OR
pros: Provides growth and development for employees, has excellent pay and benefits, forward thinking, excellent medical outcomes and very well known and respected in the communities it serves.  Asante believes in providing an excellent patient experience and has invested in its employees to ensure they have the skills, knowledge and abilities to provide excellent service.
cons: Sometimes the distance between each location makes it challenging to function as a system.

review_title: Had a lot of potential but was let bitterly disappointed
pros: I had some really awesome coworkers, the differentials for on-call, evening, and night shift were great in my opinion, the education reimbursement was actually a really good offer as well.
cons:
I was very disappointed to find management in my department very lacking. I witnessed my fellow coworkers berated in front of others. There was a large amount of favoritism for certain employees who were friends with the manager before they became management. I felt that my skills could have been used in other departments but were not, even after constant reminder that I could be trained in other departments to help with short staffing. Also one of the major reasons I chose Asante was because of their willingness to help with education; however after being told they would support me and a multitude of other employees that wanted to do online schooling to advance into further positions in the department, they decided they were no longer going to support that school and that we would have to attend other programs at more expensive colleges.
I worked full time hours constantly, but was an on-call employee and was fine with it initially but when I wanted to switch to a benefited position it took months for it to happen.
I also took a pay cut moving to this company. I'm not talking a few cents either, I took a two dollar an hour pay cut and I used to live in a lower cost of living area within 3 to 4 hours of this health system.
Overall, I expect a lot more from a company that prides themselves on their structure values of Respect, Excellence, Honesty, Teamwork, and Service. I really wanted this company to be the company I stay with for years, possibly all the way to retirement. I can now say that is not the case and have accepted employment elsewhere.

pros: There are some amazing and dedicated healthcare professionals working for this company. They go above and beyond for the patients and deliver excellent care.
cons: Just because you try rebrand management as “leadership” doesn’t make them leaders. It just makes them management with yet another unrealistic expectation put upon them setting them up for further failure.

review_title: I'm hoping this Will this be my dream job?

pros: Great pay and benefits, if your at least a part time worker,  plus employee friendly work place, room for advancement.
cons: Not enough hours when your on on call status, no benefits sure the pays okay, but you don't get enough hours to make it count.

pros: Great opportunities, a lot of good education, good people
